answers.answer: Have you talked to her doctor about seizures?  There are different types and some include zoning out without the things people typically think of regarding seizures.  good luck
it could be disassociate disorder, you might try a psychologists.

This is almost alway a sign of a neurological problem, take her to get evaluated by a doctor right away so you can rule out any of the dangerous ones. Please deal with this serriously, it is not a symptom that should ever be left alone. I hope everything goes ok with your little one. Let us know what they say.

question: I have a 10 year old daughter who is a fairly healthy girl, but not as active as i'de like her to be as she lives with her mother. Her mother has chromes disease so she spends a lot of time at home with my daughter.. I was just informed by her mother that my daughter has been BLACKING OUT, not passing out, and when she comes to shes lost time and can't remember what has happened, it happened on her way to school the other day and she walked into traffic, thank god nothing happened and she is safe, but it's getting worse and im worried that she is going to hurt herself one of these times it happens.. My family history is complicated my brother has neurofromatosis and a shunt in his head and my mother has diabetes, I am healthy as can be.. I know her mother has chromes disease but besides that im not sure about her history much.. She has been to see a few drs but they can't seem to figure out whats wrong with her. My daughter is 10 and a big girl shes about 5,9 and about 150lbs, I am very tall and her mother is taller than me, im starting to think that there's more to it than her just blacking out and losing time, please help me,  A concerned dad.
title: Blackouts and loss of time!!
